alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 12:18PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Sullivan and north central Pike Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1217 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greeley, or 14 miles northwest of Montague, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monticello, Lackawaxen, Bethel, Shohola, Tusten, Mongaup Valley, Maplewood, Smallwood, White Lake and Lava. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 103 and 105B. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
